   19: %%
   20: -module(cover_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -compile(export_all).
   23: 
   24: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   25: 
   26: suite() ->
   27:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   28:      {timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
   29: 
   30: all() -> 
   31:     NoStartStop = [eif,otp_5305,otp_5418,otp_7095,otp_8273,
   32:                    otp_8340,otp_8188,compile_beam_opts,eep37,
   33:                    analyse_no_beam, line_0, compile_beam_no_file,
   34:                    compile_beam_missing_backend,
   35:                    otp_13277, otp_13289, guard_in_lc, gh_4796,
   36:                    eep49, gh_8159],
   37:     StartStop = [start, compile, analyse, misc, stop,
   38:                  distribution, distribution_export, reconnect, die_and_reconnect,
   39:                  dont_reconnect_after_stop, stop_node_after_disconnect,
   40:                  export_import, otp_5031, otp_6115,
   41:                  otp_8270, otp_10979_hanging_node, otp_14817,
   42:                  local_only, startup_race, otp_16476, cover_clauses],
   43:     case whereis(cover_server) of
   44:         undefined ->
   45:             [coverage,StartStop ++ NoStartStop];
   46:         _pid ->
   47:             [coverage|NoStartStop++[coverage_analysis]]
   48:     end.
   49: 
   50: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   51:     [{ct_is_running_cover,whereis(cover_server) =/= undefined}|Config].
   52: 
   53: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   54:     ok.
   55: 
   56: init_per_testcase(TC, Config) when TC =:= misc; 
   57:                                    TC =:= compile;
   58:                                    TC =:= analyse;
   59:                                    TC =:= distribution;
   60:                                    TC =:= otp_5031;
   61:                                    TC =:= stop ->
   62:     case code:which(crypto) of
   63:         Path when is_list(Path) ->
   64:             init_per_testcase(dummy_tc, Config);
   65:         _Else ->
   66:             {skip, "No crypto file to test with"}
   67:     end;
   68: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   69:     Config.
   70: 
   71: end_per_testcase(TestCase, Config) ->
   72:     NoStop = [start,compile,analyse,misc],
   73:     DontStop = proplists:get_bool(ct_is_running_cover, Config) orelse
   74:     lists:member(TestCase, NoStop),
   75:     case DontStop of
   76:         true -> ok;
   77:         false -> cover:stop()
   78:     end,
   79:     ok.
   80: 
   81: coverage(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   82:     {ok,?MODULE} = cover:compile_beam(?MODULE),
   83:     ?MODULE:do_coverage(Config).
   84: 
   85: do_coverage(Config) ->
   86:     Outdir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
   87:     ExportFile = filename:join(Outdir, "export"),
   88:     ok = cover:export(ExportFile, ?MODULE),
   89:     {error,{already_started,_}} = cover:start(),
   90:     {error,_} = cover:compile_beam(non_existing_module),
   91:     _ = cover:which_nodes(),
   92:     _ = cover:modules(),
   93:     _ = cover:imported(),
   94:     {error,{not_cover_compiled,lists}} = cover:analyze(lists),
   95: 
   96:     %% Cover escaping of '&' in HTML files.
   97: 
   98:     case proplists:get_bool(ct_is_running_cover, Config) of
   99:         false ->
  100:             %% Cover server was implicitly started when this module
  101:             %% was cover-compiled. We must stop the cover server, but
  102:             %% we must ensure that this module is not on the call
  103:             %% stack when it is unloaded. Therefore, the call that
  104:             %% follows MUST be tail-recursive.
  105:             cover:stop();
  106:         true ->
  107:             %% Cover server was started by common_test; don't stop it.
  108:             ok
  109:     end.
  110: 
  111: %% This test case will only be run when common_test is running cover.
  112: coverage_analysis(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  113:     {ok,Analysis1} = cover:analyze(?MODULE),
  114:     io:format("~p\n", [Analysis1]),
  115:     {ok,Analysis2} = cover:analyze(?MODULE, calls),
  116:     io:format("~p\n", [Analysis2]),
  117:     {ok,_Analysis3} = cover:analyze(?MODULE, calls, line),
  118: 
  119:     Outdir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  120:     Outfile = filename:join(Outdir, ?MODULE),
  121: 
  122:     {ok,Outfile} = cover:analyze_to_file(?MODULE, Outfile),
  123:     {ok,Contents} = file:read_file(Outfile),
  124:     ok = file:delete(Outfile),
  125:     ok = io:put_chars(Contents),
  126:     {ok,Outfile} = cover:analyze_to_file(?MODULE, Outfile, [html]),
  127:     ok.
  128: 
  129: start(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  130:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  131: 
  132:     Files = lsfiles(),
  133:     remove(files(Files, ".out")),
  134: 
  135:     {ok, Pid} = cover:start(),
  136:     {error, {already_started, Pid}} = cover:start().
  137: 
  138: compile(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  139:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  140: 
  141:     Result1 = cover:compile_directory(),
  142:     SortedResult = lists:sort(Result1),
  143:     {ok, CWD} = file:get_cwd(),
  144:     Result2 = cover:compile_directory(CWD),
  145:     SortedResult = lists:sort(Result2),
  146:     [{error,DFile},{ok,a},{ok,b},{ok,cc},{ok,f}] = SortedResult,
  147:     [{ok,e}] = cover:compile_directory("d1"),
  148:     {error,enoent} = cover:compile_directory("d2"),
  149: 
  150:     [] = cover:compile([]),
  151:     Result21 = cover:compile([a,b,"cc.erl",d,"f"]),
  152:     SortedResult21 = lists:sort(Result21),
  153:     [{error,DFile},{ok,a},{ok,b},{ok,cc},{ok,f}] = SortedResult21,
  154: 
  155:     {ok,a} = cover:compile(a),
  156:     {ok,b} = compile:file(b),
  157:     code:purge(b),
  158:     {module,b} = code:load_file(b),
  159:     {ok,d} = cover:compile("d.erl", [{d,'AGE',42}]),
  160:     {error,_BBFile} = cover:compile(bb),
  161: 
  162:     StdlibDir = code:lib_dir(stdlib),
  163:     Lists = filename:join([StdlibDir, "src", "lists.erl"]),
  164:     {error, Lists} = cover:compile(Lists),
  165: 
  166:     %% For compiling beam: using dummy files v,w,x,y and z
  167:     file:set_cwd("compile_beam"),
  168:     {ok,_} = compile:file(v,[debug_info,report]),
  169:     {ok,_} = compile:file(w,[debug_info,report]),
  170:     {ok,_} = compile:file(x),
  171:     {ok,_} = compile:file("d/y",[debug_info,{outdir,"d"},report]),
  172:     Key = "A Krypto Key",
  173:     CryptoWorks = crypto_works(),
  174:     case CryptoWorks of
  175:         false ->
  176:             {ok,_} = compile:file(crypt, [debug_info,report]),
  177:             {ok,crypt} = cover:compile_beam("crypt.beam");
  178:         true ->
  179:             {ok,_} = compile:file(crypt, [{debug_info_key,Key},report]),
  180:             {error,{encrypted_abstract_code,_}} =
  181:             cover:compile_beam("crypt.beam"),
  182:             ok = beam_lib:crypto_key_fun(simple_crypto_fun(Key)),
  183:             {ok,crypt} = cover:compile_beam("crypt.beam")
  184:     end,
  185:     Path = filename:join([proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "compile_beam", "v.erl"]),
  186:     {ok,v} = cover:compile_beam(v),
  187:     {source,Path} = lists:keyfind(source, 1, v:module_info(compile)),
  188:     {ok,w} = cover:compile_beam("w.beam"),
  189:     {error,{no_abstract_code,"./x.beam"}} = cover:compile_beam(x),
  190:     {error,{already_cover_compiled,no_beam_found,a}}=cover:compile_beam(a),
  191:     {error,non_existing} = cover:compile_beam(z),
  192:     [{ok,y}] = cover:compile_beam_directory("d"),
  193:     Result3 = lists:sort(cover:compile_beam_directory()),
  194:     [{error,{no_abstract_code,XBeam}},{ok,crypt},{ok,v},{ok,w}] = Result3,
  195:     {error,enoent} = cover:compile_beam_directory("d2"),
  196: 
  197:     [] = cover:compile_beam([]),
  198:     Result31 = cover:compile_beam([crypt,"v.beam",w,"x"]),
  199:     SortedResult31 = lists:sort(Result31),
  200:     [{error,{no_abstract_code,XBeam}},{ok,crypt},{ok,v},{ok,w}] = SortedResult31,
  201: 
  202:     decompile([v,w,y]),
  203:     Files = lsfiles(),
  204:     remove(files(Files, ".beam")).
  205: 
  206: crypto_works() ->
  207:     try crypto:start() of
  208:         {error,{already_started,crypto}} -> true;
  209:         ok -> true
  210:     catch
  211:         error:_ ->
  212:             false
  213:     end.
  214: 
  215: simple_crypto_fun(Key) ->
  216:     fun(init) -> ok;
  217:        ({debug_info, des3_cbc, crypt, _}) -> Key
  218:     end.
  219: 
  220: analyse(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  221:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  222: 
  223:     done = a:start(5),
  224: 
  225:     {ok, {a,{17,2}}=ACovMod} = cover:analyse(a, coverage, module),
  226:     {ok, [{{a,exit_kalle,0},{1,0}},
  227:           {{a,loop,3},{5,1}},
  228:           {{a,pong,1},{1,0}},
  229:           {{a,start,1},{6,0}},
  230:           {{a,stop,1},{0,1}},
  231:           {{a,trycatch,1},{4,0}}]=ACovFunc} =
  232:     cover:analyse(a, coverage, function),
  233:     {ok, [{{a,exit_kalle,0,1},{1,0}},
  234:           {{a,loop,3,1},{3,1}},
  235:           {{a,loop,3,2},{2,0}},
  236:           {{a,pong,1,1},{1,0}},
  237:           {{a,start,1,1},{6,0}},
  238:           {{a,stop,1,1},{0,1}},
  239:           {{a,trycatch,1,1},{4,0}}]=ACovClause} =
  240:     cover:analyse(a, coverage, clause),
  241:     {ok, [{{a,9},{1,0}},
  242:           {{a,10},{1,0}},
  243:           {{a,11},{1,0}},
  244:           {{a,13},{1,0}},
  245:           {{a,14},{1,0}},
  246:           {{a,15},{1,0}},
  247:           {{a,21},{0,1}},
  248:           {{a,26},{1,0}},
  249:           {{a,31},{1,0}},
  250:           {{a,32},{1,0}},
  251:           {{a,34},{1,0}},
  252:           {{a,36},{0,1}},
  253:           {{a,39},{1,0}},
  254:           {{a,40},{1,0}},
  255:           {{a,44},{1,0}},
  256:           {{a,47},{1,0}},
  257:           {{a,49},{1,0}},
  258:           {{a,51},{1,0}},
  259:           {{a,55},{1,0}}]=ACovLine} = cover:analyse(a, coverage, line),
  260: 
  261:     {ok, {a,15}=ACallsMod} = cover:analyse(a, calls, module),
  262:     {ok, [{{a,exit_kalle,0},1},
  263:           {{a,loop,3},6},
  264:           {{a,pong,1},5},
  265:           {{a,start,1},1},
  266:           {{a,stop,1},0},
  267:           {{a,trycatch,1},2}]=ACallsFunc} = cover:analyse(a, calls, function),
  268:     {ok, [{{a,exit_kalle,0,1},1},
  269:           {{a,loop,3,1},5},
  270:           {{a,loop,3,2},1},
  271:           {{a,pong,1,1},5},
  272:           {{a,start,1,1},1},
  273:           {{a,stop,1,1},0},
  274:           {{a,trycatch,1,1},2}]=ACallsClause} = cover:analyse(a, calls, clause),
  275:     {ok, [{{a,9},1},
  276:           {{a,10},1},
  277:           {{a,11},1},
  278:           {{a,13},1},
  279:           {{a,14},1},
  280:           {{a,15},1},
  281:           {{a,21},0},
  282:           {{a,26},5},
  283:           {{a,31},5},
  284:           {{a,32},5},
  285:           {{a,34},5},
  286:           {{a,36},0},
  287:           {{a,39},1},
  288:           {{a,40},1},
  289:           {{a,44},2},
  290:           {{a,47},1},
  291:           {{a,49},1},
  292:           {{a,51},2},
  293:           {{a,55},1}]=ACallsLine} = cover:analyse(a, calls, line),
  294: 
  295:     {ok,ACovFunc} = cover:analyse(a),
  296:     {ok,ACovMod} = cover:analyse(a, module),
  297:     {ok,ACallsFunc} = cover:analyse(a, calls),
  298: 
  299:     {ok, "a.COVER.out"} = cover:analyse_to_file(a),
  300:     {ok, "e.COVER.out"} = cover:analyse_to_file(e),
  301:     {ok, "a.COVER.html"} = cover:analyse_to_file(a,[html]),
  302:     {ok, "e.COVER.html"} = cover:analyse_to_file(e,[html]),
  303: 
  304:     %% Analyse all modules
  305:     Modules = cover:modules(),
  306:     N = length(Modules),
  307: 
  308:     {result,CovFunc,[]} = cover:analyse(), % default = coverage, function
  309:     ACovFunc = [A || {{a,_,_},_}=A<-CovFunc],
  310: 
  311:     {result,CovMod,[]} = cover:analyse(coverage,module),
  312:     ACovMod = lists:keyfind(a,1,CovMod),
  313: 
  314:     {result,CovClause,[]} = cover:analyse(coverage,clause),
  315:     ACovClause = [A || {{a,_,_,_},_}=A<-CovClause],
  316: 
  317:     {result,CovLine,[]} = cover:analyse(coverage,line),
  318:     ACovLine = [A || {{a,_},_}=A<-CovLine],
  319: 
  320:     {result,CallsFunc,[]} = cover:analyse(calls,function),
  321:     ACallsFunc = [A || {{a,_,_},_}=A<-CallsFunc],
  322: 
  323:     {result,CallsMod,[]} = cover:analyse(calls,module),
  324:     ACallsMod = lists:keyfind(a,1,CallsMod),
  325: 
  326:     {result,CallsClause,[]} = cover:analyse(calls,clause),
  327:     ACallsClause = [A || {{a,_,_,_},_}=A<-CallsClause],
  328: 
  329:     {result,CallsLine,[]} = cover:analyse(calls,line),
  330:     ACallsLine = [A || {{a,_},_}=A<-CallsLine],
  331: 
  332:     {result,AllToFile,[]} = cover:analyse_to_file(),
  333:     N = length(AllToFile),
  334:     true = lists:member("a.COVER.out",AllToFile),
  335:     {result,AllToFileHtml,[]} = cover:analyse_to_file([html]),
  336:     N = length(AllToFileHtml),
  337:     true = lists:member("a.COVER.html",AllToFileHtml),
  338: 
  339:     %% Analyse list of modules
  340:     %% Listing all modules so we can compare result with above result
  341:     %% from analysing all.
  342: 
  343:     {result,CovFunc1,[]} = cover:analyse(Modules), % default = coverage, function
  344:     true = lists:sort(CovFunc) == lists:sort(CovFunc1),
  345: 
  346:     {result,CovMod1,[]} = cover:analyse(Modules,coverage,module),
  347:     true = lists:sort(CovMod) == lists:sort(CovMod1),
  348: 
  349:     {result,CovClause1,[]} = cover:analyse(Modules,coverage,clause),
  350:     true = lists:sort(CovClause) == lists:sort(CovClause1),
  351: 
  352:     {result,CovLine1,[]} = cover:analyse(Modules,coverage,line),
  353:     true = lists:sort(CovLine) == lists:sort(CovLine1),
  354: 
  355:     {result,CallsFunc1,[]} = cover:analyse(Modules,calls,function),
  356:     true = lists:sort(CallsFunc1) == lists:sort(CallsFunc1),
  357: 
  358:     {result,CallsMod1,[]} = cover:analyse(Modules,calls,module),
  359:     true = lists:sort(CallsMod) == lists:sort(CallsMod1),
  360: 
  361:     {result,CallsClause1,[]} = cover:analyse(Modules,calls,clause),
  362:     true = lists:sort(CallsClause) == lists:sort(CallsClause1),
  363: 
  364:     {result,CallsLine1,[]} = cover:analyse(Modules,calls,line),
  365:     true = lists:sort(CallsLine) == lists:sort(CallsLine1),
  366: 
  367:     {result,AllToFile1,[]} = cover:analyse_to_file(Modules),
  368:     true = lists:sort(AllToFile) == lists:sort(AllToFile1),
  369:     {result,AllToFileHtml1,[]} = cover:analyse_to_file(Modules,[html]),
  370:     true = lists:sort(AllToFileHtml) == lists:sort(AllToFileHtml1),
  371: 
  372:     %% analyse_to_file of file which is compiled from beam
  373:     {ok,f} = compile:file(f,[debug_info]),
  374:     code:purge(f),
  375:     {module,f} = code:load_file(f),
  376:     {ok,f} = cover:compile_beam(f),
  377:     f:f2(),
  378:     {ok, "f.COVER.out"} = cover:analyse_to_file(f),
  379: 
  380:     %% Source code can be found via source
  381:     {ok,v} = compile:file("compile_beam/v",[debug_info]),
  382:     code:purge(v),
  383:     {module,v} = code:load_file(v),
  384:     {ok,v} = cover:compile_beam(v),
  385:     {ok,"v.COVER.out"} = cover:analyse_to_file(v),
  386: 
  387:     %% Source code cannot be found
  388:     {ok,_} = file:copy("compile_beam/z.erl", "z.erl"),
  389:     {ok,z} = compile:file(z,[debug_info]),
  390:     code:purge(z),
  391:     {module,z} = code:load_file(z),
  392:     {ok,z} = cover:compile_beam(z),
  393:     ok = file:delete("z.erl"),
  394:     {error,{no_source_code_found,z}} = cover:analyse_to_file(z),
  395:     {result,[],[{no_source_code_found,z}]} = cover:analyse_to_file([z]),
  396:     code:purge(z),
  397:     code:delete(z),
  398: 
  399:     {error,{not_cover_compiled,b}} = cover:analyse(b),
  400:     {error,{not_cover_compiled,g}} = cover:analyse(g),
  401:     {result,[],[{not_cover_compiled,b}]} = cover:analyse([b]),
  402:     {error,{not_cover_compiled,b}} = cover:analyse_to_file(b),
  403:     {error,{not_cover_compiled,g}} = cover:analyse_to_file(g),
  404:     {result,[],[{not_cover_compiled,g}]} = cover:analyse_to_file([g]).
  405: 
  406: misc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  407:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  408: 
  409:     [a,cc,crypt,d,e,f,v] = lists:sort(cover:modules()),
  410: 
  411:     {ok,cc} = compile:file(cc),
  412:     code:purge(cc),
  413:     {module,cc} = code:load_file(cc),
  414:     [a,crypt,d,e,f,v] = lists:sort(cover:modules()),
  415: 
  416:     {file, _File} = cover:is_compiled(a),
  417:     false = cover:is_compiled(b),
  418:     false = cover:is_compiled(g),
  419: 
  420:     ok = cover:reset(a),
  421:     {ok, {a,{0,19}}} = cover:analyse(a, module),
  422:     ok = cover:reset().
  423: 
  424: stop(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  425:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  426: 
  427:     cover_compiled = code:which(a),
  428:     {ok,d} = compile:file(d, [{d,'AGE',42}]),
  429:     code:purge(d),
  430:     {module,d} = code:load_file(d),
  431:     ok = cover:stop(),
  432:     Beam = code:which(a),
  433:     true = is_unloaded(Beam),
  434: 
  435:     Files = lsfiles(),
  436:     remove(files(Files, ".out")),
  437:     remove(files(Files, ".html")),
  438:     remove(files(Files, ".beam")).
  439: 
  440: distribution(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  441:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  442:     ok = file:set_cwd(DataDir),
  443: 
  444:     {ok,P1,N1} = ?CT_PEER(),
  445:     {ok,P2,N2} = ?CT_PEER(),
  446:     {ok,P3,N3} = ?CT_PEER(),
  447:     {ok,P4,N4} = ?CT_PEER(),
  448: 
  449:     %% Check that an already compiled module is loaded on new nodes
  450:     {ok,f} = cover:compile(f),
  451:     {ok,[_,_,_,_]} = cover:start([N1,N2,N3,N4]),
  452:     cover_compiled = code:which(f),
  453:     cover_compiled = rpc:call(N1,code,which,[f]),
  454:     cover_compiled = rpc:call(N2,code,which,[f]),
  455:     cover_compiled = rpc:call(N3,code,which,[f]),
  456:     cover_compiled = rpc:call(N4,code,which,[f]),
  457: 
  458:     %% Check that a node cannot be started twice
  459:     {ok,[]} = cover:start(N2),
  460: 
  461:     %% Check that the current node (i.e. the main node) is not started with
  462:     %% start/1 and not stopped with stop/1
  463:     {ok,[]} = cover:start(node()),
  464:     ok = cover:stop(node()),
  465:     true = is_pid(whereis(cover_server)),
  466: 
  467:     %% Check that a new compiled module is loaded on all existing nodes
  468:     compile:file("compile_beam/v",[debug_info]),
  469:     {ok,v} = cover:compile_beam(v),
  470:     cover_compiled = code:which(v),
  471:     cover_compiled = rpc:call(N1,code,which,[v]),
  472:     cover_compiled = rpc:call(N2,code,which,[v]),
  473:     cover_compiled = rpc:call(N3,code,which,[v]),
  474:     cover_compiled = rpc:call(N4,code,which,[v]),
  475: 
  476:     %% this is lost when the node is killed
  477:     rpc:call(N3,f,f2,[]),
  478:     peer:stop(P3),
  479: 
  480:     %% this should be visible in analyse
  481:     rpc:call(N1,f,f1,[]),
  482: 
  483:     %% Check that data is collected from remote node when stopped
  484:     ok = cover:stop(N1),
  485:     N1Beam = rpc:call(N1,code,which,[f]),
  486:     true = is_unloaded(N1Beam),
  487:     check_f_calls(1,0),
  488: 
  489:     %% Call f:f1() again on another node and check that number of calls is
  490:     %% accumulated.
  491:     f:f1(),
  492:     check_f_calls(2,0),
  493: 
  494:     %% Check that reset works on all nodes
  495:     f:f1(),
  496:     rpc:call(N2,f,f1,[]),
  497:     ok = cover:reset(f),
  498:     check_f_calls(0,0),
  499: 
  500:     %% Check that data is collected from all nodes
  501:     rpc:call(N2,f,f1,[]),
  502:     f:f2(),
  503:     check_f_calls(1,1),
  504: 
  505:     %% Check that same data is not fetched again (i.e. that analyse does
  506:     %% reset on the remote node(s))
  507:     check_f_calls(1,1),
  508: 
  509:     %% Another checn that data is not fetched twice, i.e. when flushed
  510:     %% then analyse should not add the same data again.
  511:     rpc:call(N4,f,f2,[]),
  512:     ok = cover:flush(N4),
  513:     check_f_calls(1,2),
  514: 
  515:     %% Check that flush collects data so calls are not lost if node is killed
  516:     rpc:call(N4,f,f2,[]),
  517:     ok = cover:flush(N4),
  518:     peer:stop(P4),
  519:     check_f_calls(1,3),
  520: 
  521:     %% Check that stop() unloads on all nodes
  522:     ok = cover:stop(),
  523:     timer:sleep(100), %% Give nodes time to unload on slow machines.
  524:     LocalBeam = code:which(f),
  525:     N2Beam = rpc:call(N2,code,which,[f]),
  526:     true = is_unloaded(LocalBeam),
  527:     true = is_unloaded(N2Beam),
  528: 
  529:     %% Check that cover_server on remote node does not die if main node dies
  530:     {ok,[N1]} = cover:start(N1),
  531:     true = is_pid(N1Server = rpc:call(N1,erlang,whereis,[cover_server])),
  532:     exit(whereis(cover_server),kill),
  533:     timer:sleep(100),
  534:     N1Server = rpc:call(N1,erlang,whereis,[cover_server]),
  535: 
  536:     %% Cleanup
  537:     Files = lsfiles(),
  538:     remove(files(Files, ".beam")),
  539:     peer:stop(P1),
  540:     peer:stop(P2).
  541: 
  542: %% GH-8661. An attempt to export cover data on a remote node could
  543: %% hang if the module had been reloaded.
  544: distribution_export(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  545:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 30}),
  546: 
  547:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  548: 
  549:     ok = file:set_cwd(DataDir),
  550: 
  551:     {ok,P1,N1} = ?CT_PEER(),
  552: 
  553:     {ok,f} = cover:compile(f),
  554:     {ok,[_]} = cover:start([N1]),
  555:     ok = cover:export("f.coverdata"),
  556: 
  557:     {ok,f} = compile:file(f, [debug_info]),
  558:     {module, f} = erpc:call(N1, code, load_file, [f]),
  559: 
  560:     ok = cover:export("f.coverdata"),
  561: 
  562:     %% Cleanup
  563:     peer:stop(P1),
  564:     ok.
  565: 
  566: %% Test that a lost node is reconnected
  567: reconnect(Config) ->
  568:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  569:     ok = file:set_cwd(DataDir),
  570: 
  571:     {ok,a} = compile:file(a),
  572:     {ok,b} = compile:file(b),
  573:     {ok,f} = compile:file(f),
  574: 
  575:     {ok,P1,N1} = ?CT_PEER(#{connection => 0, args => ["-pa", DataDir]}),
  576:     {ok,a} = cover:compile(a),
  577:     {ok,f} = cover:compile(f),
  578:     {ok,[N1]} = cover:start([N1]),
  579: 
  580:     %% Some calls to check later
  581:     rpc:call(N1,f,f1,[]),
  582:     cover:flush(N1),
  583:     rpc:call(N1,f,f1,[]),
  584: 
  585:     %% This will cause first cause the N1 node to initiate a
  586:     %% disconnect and then call f:f2() when nodes() =:= [] on N1.
  587:     rpc:cast(N1,f,call_f2_when_isolated,[]),
  588:     timer:sleep(500), % allow some to detect disconnect and for f:f2() call
  589:     cover_which_nodes([]),
  590: 
  591:     %% Do some add one module (b) and remove one module (a)
  592:     code:purge(a),
  593:     {module,a} = code:load_file(a),
  594:     {ok,b} = cover:compile(b),
  595:     cover_compiled = code:which(b),
  596: 
  597:     cover_which_nodes([]),
  598:     check_f_calls(1,0), % only the first call - before the flush
  599: 
  600:     %% Reconnect the node and check that b and f are cover compiled but not a
  601:     net_kernel:connect_node(N1),
  602:     timer:sleep(100),
  603:     [N1] = cover:which_nodes(), % we are reconnected
  604:     cover_compiled = rpc:call(N1,code,which,[b]),
  605:     cover_compiled = rpc:call(N1,code,which,[f]),
  606:     ABeam = rpc:call(N1,code,which,[a]),
  607:     false = (cover_compiled==ABeam),
  608: 
  609:     %% Ensure that we have:
  610:     %% * one f1 call from before the flush,
  611:     %% * one f1 call from after the flush but before disconnect
  612:     %% * one f2 call when disconnected
  613:     check_f_calls(2,1),
  614: 
  615:     cover:stop(),
  616:     peer:stop(P1),
  617:     ok.
  618: 
  619: %% Test that a lost node is reconnected - also if it has been dead
  620: die_and_reconnect(Config) ->
  621:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  622:     ok = file:set_cwd(DataDir),
  623: 
  624:     {ok,f} = compile:file(f),
  625: 
  626:     {ok, P1, N1} = ?CT_PEER(#{name => ?CT_PEER_NAME(), args => ["-pa", DataDir]}),
  627:     %% {ok,a} = cover:compile(a),
  628:     {ok,f} = cover:compile(f),
  629:     {ok,[N1]} = cover:start([N1]),
  630: 
  631:     %% Some calls to check later
  632:     rpc:call(N1,f,f1,[]),
  633:     cover:flush(N1),
  634:     rpc:call(N1,f,f1,[]),
  635: 
  636:     %% Kill the node
  637:     peer:stop(P1),
  638:     cover_which_nodes([]),
  639: 
  640:     check_f_calls(1,0), % only the first call - before the flush
  641: 
  642:     %% Restart the node and check that cover reconnects
  643:     {ok,P2,N1} = ?CT_PEER(#{name => N1, args => ["-pa", DataDir]}),
  644:     timer:sleep(100),
  645:     [N1] = cover:which_nodes(), % we are reconnected
  646:     cover_compiled = rpc:call(N1,code,which,[f]),
  647: 
  648:     %% One more call...
  649:     rpc:call(N1,f,f1,[]),
  650: 
  651:     %% Ensure that no more calls are counted
  652:     check_f_calls(2,0),
  653: 
  654:     cover:stop(),
  655:     peer:stop(P2),
  656:     ok.
  657: 
  658: %% Test that a stopped node is not marked as lost, i.e. that it is not
  659: %% reconnected if it is restarted (OTP-10638)
  660: dont_reconnect_after_stop(Config) ->
  661:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  662:     ok = file:set_cwd(DataDir),
  663: 
  664:     {ok,f} = compile:file(f),
  665: 
  666:     {ok, P1, N1} = ?CT_PEER(#{name => ?CT_PEER_NAME(), args => ["-pa", DataDir],
  667:         start_cover => false}),
  668:     {ok,f} = cover:compile(f),
  669:     {ok,[N1]} = cover:start([N1]),
  670: 
  671:     %% A call to check later
  672:     rpc:call(N1,f,f1,[]),
  673: 
  674:     %% Stop cover on the node, then terminate the node
  675:     cover:stop(N1),
  676:     peer:stop(P1),
  677:     cover_which_nodes([]),
  678: 
  679:     check_f_calls(1,0),
  680: 
  681:     %% Restart the node and check that cover does not reconnect
  682:     {ok, P2, N1} = ?CT_PEER(#{name => N1, args => ["-pa", DataDir], start_cover => false}),
  683:     timer:sleep(300),
  684:     cover_which_nodes([]),
  685:     Beam = rpc:call(N1,code,which,[f]),
  686:     false = (Beam==cover_compiled),
  687: 
  688:     %% One more call...
  689:     rpc:call(N1,f,f1,[]),
  690:     cover:flush(N1),
  691: 
  692:     %% Ensure that the last call is not counted
  693:     check_f_calls(1,0),
  694: 
  695:     cover:stop(),
  696:     peer:stop(P2),
  697:     ok.
  698: 
  699: %% Test that a node which is stopped while it is marked as lost is not
  700: %% reconnected if it is restarted (OTP-10638)
  701: stop_node_after_disconnect(Config) ->
  702:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  703:     ok = file:set_cwd(DataDir),
  704: 
  705:     {ok,f} = compile:file(f),
  706: 
  707:     {ok, P1, N1} = ?CT_PEER(#{name => ?CT_PEER_NAME(), args => ["-pa", DataDir],
  708:         start_cover => false}),
  709:     {ok,f} = cover:compile(f),
  710:     {ok,[N1]} = cover:start([N1]),
  711: 
  712:     %% A call to check later
  713:     rpc:call(N1,f,f1,[]),
  714: 
  715:     %% Flush the node, then terminate the node to make it marked as lost
  716:     cover:flush(N1),
  717:     peer:stop(P1),
  718: 
  719:     check_f_calls(1,0),
  720: 
  721:     %% Stop cover on node
  722:     cover:stop(N1),
  723: 
  724:     %% Restart the node and check that cover does not reconnect
  725:     {ok, P2, N1} = ?CT_PEER(#{name => N1, args => ["-pa", DataDir], start_cover => false}),
  726:     timer:sleep(300),
  727:     cover_which_nodes([]),
  728:     Beam = rpc:call(N1,code,which,[f]),
  729:     false = (Beam==cover_compiled),
  730: 
  731:     %% One more call...
  732:     rpc:call(N1,f,f1,[]),
  733:     cover:flush(N1),
  734: 
  735:     %% Ensure that the last call is not counted
  736:     check_f_calls(1,0),
  737: 
  738:     cover:stop(),
  739:     peer:stop(P2),
  740:     ok.
  741: 
  742: distribution_performance(Config) ->
  743:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
  744:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir,"distribution_performance"),
  745:     AllFiles = filename:join(Dir,"*"),
  746:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(AllFiles),
  747:     code:add_patha(Dir),
  748:     M = 9,   % Generate M modules
  749:     F = 210, % with F functions
  750:     C = 10,  % and each function of C clauses
  751:     Mods = generate_modules(M,F,C,Dir),
  752: 
  753:     %    test_server:break(""),
  754: 
  755:     {ok, P1, N1} = ?CT_PEER(),
  756:     %% CFun = fun() ->
  757:     %% 		   [{ok,_} = cover:compile_beam(Mod) || Mod <- Mods]
  758:     %% 	   end,
  759:     CFun = fun() -> cover:compile_beam(Mods) end,
  760:     {_CT, _CA} = timer:tc(CFun),
  761: 
  762:     {ok,[N1]} = cover:start([N1]),
  763: 
  764:     [1 = rpc:call(N1,Mod,f1,[1]) || Mod <- Mods],
  765: 
  766:     %    Fun = fun() -> [cover:analyse(Mod,calls,function) || Mod<-Mods] end,
  767:     %    Fun = fun() -> analyse_all(Mods,calls,function) end,
  768:     %    Fun = fun() -> cover:analyse('_',calls,function) end,
  769:     Fun = fun() -> cover:analyse(Mods,calls,function) end,
  770: 
  771:     %    Fun = fun() -> [begin cover:analyse_to_file(Mod,[html]) end || Mod<-Mods] end,
  772:     %    Fun = fun() -> analyse_all_to_file(Mods,[html]) end,
  773:     %    Fun = fun() -> cover:analyse_to_file(Mods,[html]) end,
  774:     %    Fun = fun() -> cover:analyse_to_file([html]) end,
  775: 
  776:     %    Fun = fun() -> cover:reset() end,
  777: 
  778:     {_AT, _A} = timer:tc(Fun),
  779:     %    erlang:display(lists:sort([X || X={_MFA,N} <- lists:append([L || {ok,L}<-A]), N=/=0])),
  780: 
  781:     %% fprof:apply(Fun, [],[{procs,[whereis(cover_server)]}]),
  782:     %% fprof:profile(),
  783:     %% fprof:analyse(dest,[]),
  784: 
  785:     peer:stop(P1),
  786: 
  787:     code:del_path(Dir),
  788:     Files = filelib:wildcard(AllFiles),
  789:     [ok = file:delete(File) || File <- Files],
  790:     ok = file:del_dir(Dir),
  791:     ok.
  792: 
  793: %% Run analysis in parallel
  794: analyse_all(Mods,Analysis,Level) ->
  795:     Pids = [begin
  796:                 Pid = spawn(fun() ->
  797:                                     {ok,A} = cover:analyse(Mod,Analysis,Level),
  798:                                     exit(A)
  799:                             end),
  800:                 erlang:monitor(process,Pid),
  801:                 Pid
  802:             end || Mod <- Mods],
  803:     get_downs(Pids,[]).
  804: 
  805: analyse_all_to_file(Mods,Opts) ->
  806:     Pids = [begin
  807:                 Pid = cover:async_analyse_to_file(Mod,Opts),
  808:                 erlang:monitor(process,Pid),
  809:                 Pid
  810:             end || Mod <- Mods],
  811:     get_downs(Pids,[]).
  812: 
  813: get_downs([],Acc) ->
  814:     Acc;
  815: get_downs(Pids,Acc) ->
  816:     receive
  817:         {'DOWN', _Ref, _Type, Pid, A} ->
  818:             get_downs(lists:delete(Pid,Pids),[A|Acc])
  819:     end.
  820: 
  821: generate_modules(0,_,_,_) ->
  822:     [];
  823: generate_modules(M,F,C,Dir) ->
  824:     ModStr = "m" ++ integer_to_list(M),
  825:     Mod = list_to_atom(ModStr),
  826:     Src = ["-module(",ModStr,").\n"
  827:            "-compile(export_all).\n" |
  828:            generate_functions(F,C)],
  829:     Erl = filename:join(Dir,ModStr++".erl"),
  830:     ok = file:write_file(Erl,Src),
  831:     {ok,Mod} = compile:file(Erl,[{outdir,Dir},debug_info,report]),
  832:     [Mod | generate_modules(M-1,F,C,Dir)].
  833: 
  834: generate_functions(0,_) ->
  835:     [];
  836: generate_functions(F,C) ->
  837:     Func = "f" ++ integer_to_list(F),
  838:     [generate_clauses(C,Func) | generate_functions(F-1,C)].
  839: 
  840: generate_clauses(0,_) ->
  841:     [];
  842: generate_clauses(C,Func) ->
  843:     CStr = integer_to_list(C),
  844:     Sep = if C==1 -> "."; true -> ";" end,
  845:     [Func,"(",CStr,") -> ",CStr,Sep,"\n" |
  846:      generate_clauses(C-1,Func)].
  847: 
  848: 
  849: export_import(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  850:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  851:     ok = file:set_cwd(DataDir),
  852:     PortCount = length(erlang:ports()),
  853: 
  854:     %% Export one module
  855:     {ok,f} = cover:compile(f),
  856:     f:f1(),
  857:     %% check that no info is written about where data comes from when no
  858:     %% files are imported
  859:     test_server:capture_start(),
  860:     check_f_calls(1,0),
  861:     [] = test_server:capture_get(),
  862:     test_server:capture_stop(),
  863:     ok = cover:export("f_exported",f),
  864:     check_f_calls(1,0),
  865:     ok = cover:stop(),
  866: 
  867:     %% Check that same data exists after import and that info is written about
  868:     %% data coming from imported file
  869:     ok = cover:import("f_exported"),
  870:     test_server:capture_start(),
  871:     check_f_calls(1,0),
  872:     [Text1] = test_server:capture_get(),
  873:     "Analysis includes data from imported files"++_ = lists:flatten(Text1),
  874:     test_server:capture_stop(),
  875: 
  876:     %% Export all modules
  877:     {ok,a} = cover:compile(a),
  878:     test_server:capture_start(),
  879:     ok = cover:export("all_exported"),
  880:     [] = test_server:capture_get(),
  881:     %    "Export includes data from imported files"++_ = lists:flatten(Text2),
  882:     test_server:capture_stop(),
  883:     ok = cover:stop(),
  884:     ok = cover:import("all_exported"),
  885:     check_f_calls(1,0),
  886: 
  887:     %% Check that data is reset when module is compiled again, and that
  888:     %% warning is written when data is deleted for imported module.
  889:     test_server:capture_start(),
  890:     {ok,f} = cover:compile(f),
  891:     [Text3] = test_server:capture_get(),
  892:     "WARNING: Deleting data for module f imported from" ++ _ = lists:flatten(Text3),
  893:     test_server:capture_stop(),
  894:     check_f_calls(0,0),
  895: 
  896:     %% Check that data is summed up when first compiled and then imported
  897:     %% The module which has been compiled (f) is loaded from the file 
  898:     %% all_exported again (since it has been reset during cover compiling), 
  899:     %% but the other module (a) is not loaded since it is already loaded    
  900:     f:f1(),
  901:     f:f2(),
  902:     ok = cover:import("f_exported"),
  903:     test_server:capture_start(),
  904:     ok = cover:import("all_exported"),
  905:     [Text4] = test_server:capture_get(), % a is not loaded again
  906:     "WARNING: Module a already imported from " ++ _ = lists:flatten(Text4),
  907:     test_server:capture_stop(),
  908:     check_f_calls(3,1),
  909: 
  910:     %% Check that warning is written when same file is imported twice,
  911:     %% and that data is not imported again
  912:     test_server:capture_start(),
  913:     ok = cover:import("all_exported"),
  914:     [Text5,Text6] = test_server:capture_get(),
  915:     "WARNING: Module f already imported from " ++ _ = lists:flatten(Text5),
  916:     "WARNING: Module a already imported from " ++ _ = lists:flatten(Text6),
  917:     test_server:capture_stop(),
  918:     check_f_calls(3,1),
  919: 
  920:     %% Check that reset removes all data and that the file which has been
  921:     %% reset can be imported again with no warning
  922:     cover:reset(f),
  923:     check_f_calls(0,0),
  924:     test_server:capture_start(),
  925:     ok = cover:import("all_exported"),
  926:     [Text7] = test_server:capture_get(), % warning only on mod a
  927:     "WARNING: Module a already imported from " ++ _ = lists:flatten(Text7),
  928:     test_server:capture_stop(),
  929:     check_f_calls(1,0),
  930: 
  931:     %% same as above - only reset all
  932:     cover:reset(),
  933:     check_f_calls(0,0),
  934:     test_server:capture_start(),
  935:     ok = cover:import("all_exported"),
  936:     [] = test_server:capture_get(), % no warnings
  937:     test_server:capture_stop(),
  938:     check_f_calls(1,0),
  939: 
  940:     %% Check no raw files are left open
  941:     PortCount = length(erlang:ports()),
  942: 
  943:     %% Cleanup
  944:     ok = cover:stop(),
  945:     Files = lsfiles(),
  946:     remove(["f_exported","all_exported"|files(Files, ".beam")]).
  947: 
  948: 
  949: otp_5031(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  950:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),

  953:     {ok,[N1]} = cover:start(N1),
  954:     {error,not_main_node} = rpc:call(N1,cover,modules,[]),
  955:     cover:stop(),
  956:     peer:stop(Peer),
  957:     ok.
  958: 
  959: %% Test the \'Exclude Included Functions\' functionality
  960: eif(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  961:     ok = file:set_cwd(filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  962:                                     "included_functions")),
  963:     {ok, cover_inc} = compile:file(cover_inc,[debug_info]),
  964:     {ok, cover_inc} = cover:compile_beam(cover_inc),
  965: 
  966:     %% This function will cause an included function to be executed.
  967:     %% The analysis should only show the lines that actually exist
  968:     %% in cover_inc.beam - not the ones from the included file.
  969:     cover_inc:func(),
  970:     {ok, [_, _]} = cover:analyse(cover_inc, line),
  971:     ok.
  972: 
  973: otp_5305(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  974:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  975: 
  976:     File = "t.erl",
  977:     Test = <<"-module(t).
  978:               -export([t/0]).
  979:               -include_lib(\"stdlib/include/ms_transform.hrl\").
  980:               t() ->
  981:                   ets:fun2ms(fun(X) -> X end).
  982:              ">>,
  983:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
  984:     {ok, t} = cover:compile(File),
  985:     ok = file:delete(File),
  986:     ok.

  992:     Test = <<"-module(t).
  993:              ">>,

 1000: otp_6115(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1001:     {ok, CWD} = file:get_cwd(),
 1002:     Dir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), otp_6115),
 1003:     ok = file:set_cwd(Dir),
 1004:     {ok, f1} = compile:file(f1, [debug_info]),
 1005:     {ok, f2} = compile:file(f2, [debug_info]),
 1006: 
 1007:     %% Cover compile f1, but not f2
 1008:     {ok, f1} = cover:compile(f1),
 1009: 
 1010:     %% This test used to ensure that a process containing a
 1011:     %% fun referring to cover compiled code was killed.
 1012:     %% check_process_code may however ignore funs as of ERTS
 1013:     %% version 8.1. The test has therefore been rewritten to
 1014:     %% check that a process with a direct reference (in this
 1015:     %% case a return address) to the code is killed.
 1016:     %% 
 1017:     %% If f1 is cover compiled, a process P is started with a
 1018:     %% direct reference to the f1, and cover:stop() is called,
 1019:     %% then P should be killed.
 1020:     %% This is because of the return address to the cover
 1021:     %% compiled code which should be *unloaded* when cover:stop() is
 1022:     %% called -- running cover compiled code when there is no cover
 1023:     %% server and thus no ets tables to bump counters in, makes no
 1024:     %% sense.
 1025:     Pid = spawn(fun () -> f1:non_tail_call_f2_wait() end),
 1026: 
 1027:     %% Now stop cover
 1028:     cover:stop(),
 1029: 
 1030:     %% Ensure that f1 is loaded (and not cover compiled), and that
 1031:     %% both Pid is dead.
 1032:     case code:which(f1) of
 1033:         Beam when is_list(Beam) ->
 1034:             ok;
 1035:         Other ->
 1036:             ct:fail({"f1 is not reloaded", Other})
 1037:     end,
 1038:     case process_info(Pid) of
 1039:         undefined ->
 1040:             ok;
 1041:         _PI ->
 1042:             RefToOldP = erlang:check_process_code(Pid, f1),
 1043:             ct:fail({"Pid still alive", RefToOldP})
 1044:     end,
 1045: 
 1046:     file:set_cwd(CWD),
 1047:     ok.
 1048: 
 1049: %% andalso/orelse
 1050: otp_7095(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1051:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1052: 
 1053:     File = "t.erl",
 1054:     Test = <<"-module(t).
 1055:               -export([t/0]).
 1056:               t() ->
 1057:                   t1(),
 1058:                   t2(),
 1059:                   t3(),
 1060:                   t4(),
 1061:                   t5(),
 1062:                   put(t6, 0),
 1063:                   0  = t6(),
 1064:                   1 = erase(t6),
 1065:                   t7(),
 1066:                   put(t8, 0),
 1067:                   {'EXIT',{{badarg,0},_}} = (catch t8()),
 1068:                   1 = erase(t8),
 1069:                   t9(),
 1070:                   ok.
 1071: 
 1072:               t1() ->
 1073:                   false        % 20
 1074:                     andalso
 1075:                   true.        % 22
 1076:

 1078:                   true         % 25
 1079:                     andalso
 1080:                   true.        % 27

 1083:                   false        % 30

 1088:                   true         % 35

 1093:                   true         % 40

 1104:                   true         % 51

 1106:                   false        % 53

 1111:                   true         % 58

 1113:                   true         % 60

 1120:                   if           % 67
 1121:                       true -> 
 1122:                           true % 69
 1123:                             andalso 
 1124:                           false % 71
 1125:                   end
 1126:                     orelse
 1127:                   case ok of   % 74
 1128:                       true -> 
 1129:                           a;   % 76
 1130:                       _ -> 
 1131:                           true % 78
 1132:                   end.
 1133: 
 1134:               add_one(T) ->
 1135:                   put(T, get(T) + 1). % 82
 1136:              ">>,
 1137:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 1138:     {ok, t} = cover:compile(File),
 1139:     ok = t:t(),
 1140:     {ok,[{{t,4},1},{{t,5},1},{{t,6},1},{{t,7},1},{{t,8},1},{{t,9},1},
 1141:          {{t,10},1},{{t,11},1},{{t,12},1},{{t,13},1},{{t,14},1},
 1142:          {{t,15},1},{{t,16},1},{{t,17},1},
 1143:          {{t,20},1},{{t,22},0},
 1144:          {{t,25},1},{{t,27},1},
 1145:          {{t,30},1},{{t,32},1},
 1146:          {{t,35},1},{{t,37},0},
 1147:          {{t,40},1},{{t,42},1},{{t,44},1},
 1148:          {{t,47},1},{{t,48},1},
 1149:          {{t,51},1},{{t,53},1},{{t,55},0},
 1150:          {{t,58},1},{{t,60},1},{{t,62},1},{{t,64},0},
 1151:          {{t,67},1},{{t,69},1},{{t,71},1},{{t,74},1},
 1152:          {{t,76},0},{{t,78},1},
 1153:          {{t,82},2}]} = cover:analyse(t, calls, line),
 1154:     ok = file:delete(File),
 1155:     ok.

 1179:              "   case ets:info(cover_internal_data_table, size) of\n"

 1183:              "           % error_logger:info_msg(\"~p: ~p ~p change~n L1 ~p~n\", \n"

 1202:

 1204:     {N1,true} = {N1,is_list(N1_info)},
 1205:     {N2,true} = {N2,is_list(N2_info)},
 1206:     {N3,true} = {N3,is_list(N3_info)},
 1207: 
 1208:     exit(Pid1,kill),
 1209:     peer:stop(P1),
 1210:     peer:stop(P2),
 1211:     peer:stop(P3),

 1497:                                   "          end,\n"
 1498:                                   "          3],\n"
 1499:                                   "    math:sqrt(X) > 1.0,\n" % 3
 1500:                                   "    true,\n" % 2
 1501:                                   "    true]. \n" % 2
 1502:                                   "  two() -> 2">>, Cf), % 1
 1503: 
 1504:     [{{t,1},1},
 1505:      {{t,2},2},
 1506:      {{t,3},1},
 1507:      {{t,4},1},
 1508:      {{t,5},0},
 1509:      {{t,8},1},
 1510:      {{t,9},0},
 1511:      {{t,12},3},
 1512:      {{t,13},2},
 1513:      {{t,14},2}] = analyse_expr(<<"<< \n" % 1
 1514:                                   " << (X*2) >> || \n" % 2
 1515:                                   "    <<X>> <= << (case two() of\n"
 1516:                                   "                     2 -> 1;\n" % 1
 1517:                                   "                     _ -> 2\n" % 0
 1518:                                   "                 end)/integer,\n"
 1519:                                   "                (case two() of \n"
 1520:                                   "                    2 -> 2;\n" % 1
 1521:                                   "                    _ -> two\n" % 0
 1522:                                   "                 end)/integer,\n"
 1523:                                   "                3 >>, \n"
 1524:                                   "    math:sqrt(X) > 1.0,\n" % 3
 1525:                                   "    true >>.\n" % 2
 1526:                                   "two() -> 2">>, Cf),
 1527:     [{{t,1},1},
 1528:      {{t,2},4},
 1529:      {{t,4},1},
 1530:      {{t,6},1},
 1531:      {{t,7},0},
 1532:      {{t,10},3},
 1533:      {{t,11},2},
 1534:      {{t,12},4},
 1535:      {{t,13},1}] = analyse_expr(<<"<< \n" % 1
 1536:                                   " << (2)\n" % 4
 1537:                                   "     :(8) >> || \n"
 1538:                                   "    <<X>> <= << 1,\n" % 1
 1539:                                   "                (case two() of \n"
 1540:                                   "                    2 -> 2;\n" % 1
 1541:                                   "                    _ -> two\n" % 0
 1542:                                   "                 end)/integer,\n"
 1543:                                   "                3 >>, \n"
 1544:                                   "    math:sqrt(X) > 1.0,\n" % 3
 1545:                                   "    <<_>> <= << 1, 2 >>,\n" % 2
 1546:                                   "    true >>.\n" % 4
 1547:                                   "two() -> 2">>, Cf), % 1
 1548: 
 1549:     [{{t,1},1},
 1550:      {{t,2},2},
 1551:      {{t,3},2},
 1552:      {{t,5},1},
 1553:      {{t,8},3},
 1554:      {{t,9},2},
 1555:      {{t,10},1}] =
 1556:         analyse_expr(<<"#{\n"               %1
 1557:                        "  K + 1 =>\n"       %2
 1558:                        "X * 2 ||\n"         %2
 1559:                        "    K := X <-\n"
 1560:                        "             #{1 => 1,\n" %1
 1561:                        "               2 => two(),\n"
 1562:                        "               3 => 3},\n"
 1563:                        "    X > 1,\n"           %3
 1564:                        "    true}. \n"          %2
 1565:                        "  two() -> 2">>, Cf),   %1
 1566: 
 1567:     ok.

 1570:     [{{t,1},1},{{t,2},1},{{t,4},6},{{t,6},1},{{t,8},1}] =

 1572:                    "    F =\n" % 1
 1573:                    "        fun Fact(N) when N > 0 ->\n"
 1574:                    "                N * Fact(N - 1);\n" % 6
 1575:                    "            Fact(0) ->\n"
 1576:                    "                1\n" % 1
 1577:                    "        end,\n"
 1578:                    "    F(6)\n" % 1
 1579:                    "end\n">>,
 1580:                  Config),

 1583: otp_10979_hanging_node(_Config) ->
 1584: 
 1585:     P1 = processes(),
 1586: 
 1587:     cover:stop(non_existing_node),
 1588:     cover:stop(),
 1589: 
 1590:     P2 = processes(),
 1591: 
 1592:     case P2--P1 of
 1593:         [] ->
 1594:             ok;
 1595:         New ->
 1596:             [io:format("New: ~p, ~p~n",[P,process_info(P)]) || P<-New],
 1597:             ct:fail(hanging_process)
 1598:     end,
 1599: 
 1600:     ok.

 1605:               a() -> ok. b() -> ok. c() -> ok.
 1606:               d() -> ok.
 1607:              ">>,

 1613:     {ok,[{{otp_14817,3},3},

 1633: %% Take compiler options from beam in cover:compile_beam
 1634: compile_beam_opts(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1635:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1636:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1637:     IncDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1638:                            "included_functions"),
 1639:     File = filename:join([proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config), "otp_11439", "t.erl"]),
 1640:     %% use all compiler options allowed by cover:filter_options
 1641:     %% i and d don't make sense when compiling from beam though
 1642:     {ok, t} =
 1643:     compile:file(File, [{i, IncDir},
 1644:                         {d, 'BOOL'},
 1645:                         {d, 'MACRO', macro_defined},
 1646:                         export_all,
 1647:                         debug_info,
 1648:                         return_errors]),
 1649:     code:purge(t),
 1650:     code:delete(t),
 1651:     Exports =
 1652:     [{func1,0},
 1653:      {macro, 0},
 1654:      {exported,0},
 1655:      {nonexported,0},
 1656:      {module_info,0},
 1657:      {module_info,1}],
 1658:     Exports = t:module_info(exports),
 1659:     {ok, t} = cover:compile_beam("t"),
 1660:     Exports = t:module_info(exports),
 1661:     ok = file:delete("t.beam"),
 1662:     ok = file:set_cwd(Cwd),
 1663:     ok.
 1664: 
 1665: %% Don't crash if beam is not available
 1666: analyse_no_beam(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1667:     {ok, Cwd} = file:get_cwd(),
 1668:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)),
 1669: 
 1670:     code:purge(t),
 1671:     code:delete(t),
 1672: 
 1673:     {ok,_} = file:copy("compile_beam/t.erl", "t.erl"),
 1674:     {ok,t} = compile:file(t, [debug_info]),
 1675:     {module,t} = code:load_file(t),
 1676:     {ok,t} = cover:compile_beam(t),
 1677:     t:f(),
 1678:     ok = cover:export("t.coverdata"),
 1679: 
 1680:     code:purge(t),
 1681:     code:delete(t),
 1682: 
 1683:     %% this is just so that cover realises (without stopping)
 1684:     %% that this module is not cover compiled any more
 1685:     {error, {not_cover_compiled,t}} = cover:analyse(t),
 1686: 
 1687:     %% source and beam not available any more
 1688:     ok = file:delete("t.erl"),
 1689:     ok = file:delete("t.beam"),
 1690: 
 1691:     ok = cover:import("t.coverdata"),
 1692: 
 1693:     {error,{no_source_code_found,t}} = cover:analyse_to_file(t),
 1694:     {result,[],[{no_source_code_found,t}]} = cover:analyse_to_file([t]),
 1695: 
 1696:     ok = file:delete("t.coverdata"),
 1697:     ok = file:set_cwd(Cwd),
 1698:     ok.
 1699: 
 1700: %% When including eunit.hrl, a parse transform adds the function
 1701: %% test/0 to line 0 in your module. A bug in OTP-18.0 caused
 1702: %% cover:analyse_to_file/1 to fail to insert cover data in the output
 1703: %% file in this situation. The test below tests that this bug is
 1704: %% corrected.
 1705: line_0(Config) ->
 1706:     ok = file:set_cwd(filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1707:                                     "include_eunit_hrl")),
 1708:     {ok, cover_inc_eunit} = compile:file(cover_inc_eunit,[debug_info]),
 1709:     {ok, cover_inc_eunit} = cover:compile_beam(cover_inc_eunit),
 1710:     {ok, CovOut} = cover:analyse_to_file(cover_inc_eunit),
 1711: 
 1712:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(CovOut),
 1713:     Match = <<"0..|      ok.\n">>,  % "0.." is missing when bug is there
 1714:     S = byte_size(Bin)-byte_size(Match),
 1715:     <<_:S/binary,Match/binary>> = Bin,
 1716:     ok.
 1717: 
 1718: 
 1719: %% OTP-13200: Return error instead of crashing when trying to compile
 1720: %% a beam which has no 'file' attribute.
 1721: compile_beam_no_file(Config) ->
 1722:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config),
 1723:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir,"compile_beam_no_file"),
 1724:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(filename:join(Dir,"*")),
 1725:     code:add_patha(Dir),
 1726:     Str = lists:concat(
 1727:             ["-module(nofile).\n"
 1728:              "-compile(export_all).\n"
 1729:              "foo() -> ok.\n"]),
 1730:     TT = do_scan(Str),
 1731:     Forms = [ begin {ok,Y} = erl_parse:parse_form(X),Y end || X <- TT ],
 1732:     {ok,_,Bin} = compile:forms(Forms,[debug_info]),
 1733:     BeamFile = filename:join(Dir,"nofile.beam"),
 1734:     ok = file:write_file(BeamFile,Bin),
 1735:     {error,{no_file_attribute,BeamFile}} = cover:compile_beam(nofile),
 1736:     [{error,{no_file_attribute,BeamFile}}] = cover:compile_beam_directory(Dir),
 1737:     ok.
 1738: 
 1739: %% GH-4353: Don't crash when the backend for generating the abstract code
 1740: %% is missing.
 1741: compile_beam_missing_backend(Config) ->
 1742:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1743:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, ?FUNCTION_NAME),
 1744:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(filename:join(Dir, "*")),
 1745:     code:add_patha(Dir),
 1746:     Str = lists:append(
 1747:             ["-module(no_backend).\n"
 1748:              "-compile(export_all).\n"
 1749:              "foo() -> ok.\n"]),
 1750:     TT = do_scan(Str),
 1751:     Forms = [ begin {ok,Y} = erl_parse:parse_form(X),Y end || X <- TT ],
 1752:     {ok,_,Bin} = compile:forms(Forms, [debug_info]),
 1753: 
 1754:     %% Create a debug_info chunk with a non-existing backend.
 1755:     {ok,no_backend,All0} = beam_lib:all_chunks(Bin),
 1756:     FakeBackend = definitely__not__an__existing__backend,
 1757:     FakeDebugInfo = {debug_info_v1,FakeBackend,nothing_here},
 1758:     All = lists:keyreplace("Dbgi", 1, All0, {"Dbgi", term_to_binary(FakeDebugInfo)}),
 1759:     {ok,NewBeam} = beam_lib:build_module(All),
 1760:     BeamFile = filename:join(Dir, "no_backend.beam"),
 1761:     ok = file:write_file(BeamFile, NewBeam),
 1762: 
 1763:     {error,{{missing_backend,FakeBackend},BeamFile}} = cover:compile_beam(no_backend),
 1764:     [{error,{{missing_backend,FakeBackend},BeamFile}}] = cover:compile_beam_directory(Dir),
 1765: 
 1766:     ok.
 1767: 
 1768: do_scan([]) ->
 1769:     [];
 1770: do_scan(Str) ->
 1771:     {done,{ok,T,_},C} = erl_scan:tokens([],Str,0),
 1772:     [ T | do_scan(C) ].
 1773:

 1807: guard_in_lc(Config) ->
 1808:     Test = <<"-module(t).
 1809:               -export([lc/1]).
 1810: 
 1811:               lc(L) ->
 1812:                   [V || V <- L, V == a orelse element(1, V) == a].
 1813:              ">>,
 1814: 
 1815:     %% The filter in the list comprehension must be compiled as a
 1816:     %% guard expression. Therefore, `cover` must NOT rewrite the list
 1817:     %% comprehension in the test code like this:
 1818:     %%
 1819:     %% [V || V <- L,
 1820:     %%       case V == a of
 1821:     %%           true -> true;
 1822:     %%           false -> element(1, V) == a
 1823:     %%       end].
 1824: 
 1825:     File = cc_mod(t, Test, Config),
 1826:     [a,{a,good}] = t:lc([a, b, {x,y}, {a,good}, "ignore"]),
 1827:     ok = file:delete(File),
 1828:     ok.

 1830: local_only(Config) ->
 1831:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config)),
 1832: 
 1833:     %% Trying restricting to local nodes too late.
 1834:     cover:start(),
 1835:     {ok,a} = cover:compile(a),
 1836:     [a] = cover:modules(),
 1837:     {error,too_late} = cover:local_only(),
 1838:     cover:stop(),
 1839: 
 1840:     %% Now test local only mode.
 1841:     cover:start(),
 1842:     ok = cover:local_only(),
 1843:     [] = cover:modules(),
 1844:     {ok,a} = cover:compile(a),
 1845:     [a] = cover:modules(),
 1846:     done = a:start(5),
 1847:     {ok, {a,{17,2}}} = cover:analyse(a, coverage, module),
 1848:     {ok, [{{a,exit_kalle,0},{1,0}},
 1849:           {{a,loop,3},{5,1}},
 1850:           {{a,pong,1},{1,0}},
 1851:           {{a,start,1},{6,0}},
 1852:           {{a,stop,1},{0,1}},
 1853:           {{a,trycatch,1},{4,0}}]} =
 1854:         cover:analyse(a, coverage, function),
 1855: 
 1856:     %% Make sure that it is not possible to run cover on
 1857:     %% slave nodes.
 1858:     {ok,Peer,Name} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1859:     {error,local_only} = cover:start([Name]),
 1860:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1861:     ok.
 1862: 
 1863: %% ERL-943; We should not crash on startup when multiple servers race to
 1864: %% register the server name.
 1865: startup_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1866:     PidRefs = [spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1867:                                      case cover:start() of
 1868:                                          {error, {already_started, _Pid}} ->
 1869:                                              ok;
 1870:                                          {ok, _Pid} ->
 1871:                                              ok
 1872:                                      end
 1873:                              end) || _<- lists:seq(1,8)],
 1874:     startup_race_1(PidRefs).
 1875: 
 1876: startup_race_1([{Pid, Ref} | PidRefs]) ->
 1877:     receive
 1878:         {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, normal} ->
 1879:             startup_race_1(PidRefs);
 1880:         {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, _Other} ->
 1881:             ct:fail("Cover server crashed on startup.")
 1882:     after 5000 ->
 1883:             ct:fail("Timed out.")
 1884:     end;
 1885: startup_race_1([]) ->
 1886:     cover:stop(),
 1887:     ok.
 1888:

 1891:     Dir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1892:                         ?FUNCTION_NAME),
 1893:     ok = file:set_cwd(Dir),
 1894:     {ok, Mod} = compile:file(Mod, [debug_info]),
 1895:     {ok, Mod} = cover:compile(Mod),
 1896:     ok = Mod:Mod(),
 1897:     ok = cover:stop(),
 1898:     ok.

 1920:         ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),

 1941:                   maybe                         %19

 1953:                   maybe                         %31

 1957:                   else
 1958:                       {error,_} ->
 1959:                           error                 %37
 1960:                   end.

 1975:     ok = file:set_cwd(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config)),

 1979:     Test = ~"""

 1983:             """,
 1984:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 1985:     {ok, M} = cover:compile(File),

 1989:

 1998:     {ok,[{{M,3},{1,0}}]} = cover:analyse(M, coverage, line),
 1999:

 2001:     {ok,[{{M,aaa,0},1}, {{M,bbb,0},1}, {{M,ccc,0},1}]} = cover:analyse(M, calls, function),

 2004:

 2007:     {ok,[{{M,3},{1,0}}]} = cover:analyse(M, coverage, line),
 2008: 
 2009:     cover:reset(),
 2010: 
 2011:     not_ok = M:aaa(),
 2012:     {ok,[{{M,3},1}]} = cover:analyse(M, calls, line),
 2013: 
 2014:     ok = file:delete(File),
 2015:

 2019: %%--Auxiliary------------------------------------------------------------
 2020: 
 2021: analyse_expr(Expr, Config) ->
 2022:     Binary = [<<"-module(t). "
 2023:                 "-export([t/0]). "
 2024:                 "t() -> ">>, Expr, <<".\n">>],
 2025:     File = cc_mod(t, Binary, Config),
 2026:     t:t(),
 2027:     {ok, Result} = cover:analyse(t, calls, line),
 2028:     ok = file:delete(File),
 2029:     Result.
 2030: 
 2031: cc_mod(M, Binary, Config) ->
 2032:     {ok, Dir} = file:get_cwd(),
 2033:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2034:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
 2035:     File = atom_to_list(M) ++ ".erl",
 2036:     try 
 2037:         ok = file:write_file(File, Binary),
 2038:         {ok, M} = cover:compile(File),
 2039:         filename:join(PrivDir, File)
 2040:     after file:set_cwd(Dir)
 2041:     end.
 2042: 
 2043: c_mod(M, Binary, Config) ->
 2044:     c_mod(M, Binary, Config, _CompileOpts = []).
 2045: 
 2046: c_mod(M, Binary, Config, CompileOpts) ->
 2047:     {ok, Dir} = file:get_cwd(),
 2048:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2049:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
 2050:     File = atom_to_list(M) ++ ".erl",
 2051:     try 
 2052:         ok = file:write_file(File, Binary),
 2053:         {ok, M} = compile:file(File, CompileOpts ++ [debug_info]),
 2054:         code:purge(M),
 2055:         AbsFile = filename:rootname(File, ".erl"),
 2056:         code:load_abs(AbsFile, M),
 2057:         filename:join(PrivDir, File)
 2058:     after file:set_cwd(Dir)
 2059:     end.
 2060: 
 2061: lsfiles() ->
 2062:     {ok, CWD} = file:get_cwd(),
 2063:     lsfiles(CWD).
 2064: 
 2065: lsfiles(Dir) ->
 2066:     {ok, Files} = file:list_dir(Dir),
 2067:     Files.
 2068: 
 2069: files(Files, Ext) ->
 2070:     lists:filter(fun(File) ->
 2071:                          case filename:extension(File) of
 2072:                              Ext -> true;
 2073:                              _ -> false
 2074:                          end
 2075:                  end,
 2076:                  Files).
 2077: 
 2078: remove([File|Files]) ->
 2079:     ok = file:delete(File),
 2080:     remove(Files);
 2081: remove([]) ->
 2082:     ok.
 2083: 
 2084: decompile([Mod|Mods]) ->
 2085:     code:purge(Mod),
 2086:     code:delete(Mod),
 2087:     decompile(Mods);
 2088: decompile([]) ->
 2089:     ok.
 2090: 
 2091: is_unloaded(What) ->
 2092:     if
 2093:         is_list(What) -> true;
 2094:         What==non_existing -> true;
 2095:         true -> false
 2096:     end.
 2097: 
 2098: check_f_calls(F1,F2) ->
 2099:     {ok,A} = cover:analyse(f,calls,function),
 2100:     {_,F1} = lists:keyfind({f,f1,0},1,A),
 2101:     {_,F2} = lists:keyfind({f,f2,0},1,A).
 2102: 
 2103: cover_which_nodes(Expected) ->
 2104:     case cover:which_nodes() of
 2105:         Expected ->
 2106:             ok;
 2107:         Other ->
 2108:             {Time,ok} = timer:tc(fun Retry() ->
 2109:                                          case cover:which_nodes() of
 2110:                                              Expected -> ok;
 2111:                                              _ ->
 2112:                                                  timer:sleep(100),
 2113:                                                  Retry()
 2114:                                          end
 2115:     end),
 2116:             io:format("~p ms before cover:which_nodes() returned ~p",
 2117:                       [Time,Expected]),
 2118:             Expected = Other
 2119:     end.
